item.title: Larry Summers
item.description:
Larry Summers

Summers published an article title, "The Age of Secular Stagnation: What It Is and What to Do About It," in the February issue of Foreign Affairs. The article explores how expansionary fiscal policy by the U.S. government can help overcome secular stagnation problems and get growth back on track.

item.title: A LOOK AT CAPITAL IN THE 21ST CENTURY
item.description: A LOOK AT CAPITAL IN THE 21ST CENTURY

item.title: EU Parliament's Draft of New Prospectus Directive Meets Crowdfunding Sector Demands - Crowdfund Insider
item.description:
EU Parliament's Draft of New Prospectus Directive Meets Crowdfunding Sector Demands - Crowdfund Insider

Earlier this year, the crowdfunding sector represented by the European Crowdfunding Network (ECN) the UK Crowdfunding Association, Financement Participatif France and Nederland Crowdfunding had called on the Parliament and the European Council to be very ambitious with the planned revision of the Prospectus Directive. The Parliament listened to their arguments.

item.title: JOBS Act Revisited: What's Working & What's Not (Video) - Crowdfund Insider
item.description:
JOBS Act Revisited: What's Working & What's Not (Video) - Crowdfund Insider

Below is a video of a panel that took place this past March at a crowdfunding event put together by Crowdfund Beat Media that brought together several prominent names in the internet finance space. Sam Guzik, a Crowdfund Insider Senior Contributor, Doug Ellenoff, DJ Paul, Donna Hamlin and Jonathan Frutkin joined together to discuss, and at times disagree, what is working within the investment crowdfunding space.

item.title: Social ownership - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
item.description:
Social ownership - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

In the subsequent socialist calculation debates, a dichotomy between socialists emerged between those who argued that socialization entailed the end of monetary valuation and capital markets, and those who argued that monetary prices could be used within a socialized economy.

item.title: Reg A+: A Successful First Year Despite Regulatory Ambiguities - Crowdfund Insider
item.description:
Reg A+: A Successful First Year Despite Regulatory Ambiguities - Crowdfund Insider

The "democratization of investment" in historically closed industries have been the buzzwords of choice since the JOBS Act was signed into to law in 2012. But only since March 25, 2015, when the SEC voted to adopt the proposed rules implementing Title IV, was access truly granted to all.

item.title: SEC Chair Mary Jo White Addresses the Challenges of Fintech, Pre-IPO Finance in the Heart of Silicon Valley - Crowdfund Insider
item.description:
SEC Chair Mary Jo White Addresses the Challenges of Fintech, Pre-IPO Finance in the Heart of Silicon Valley - Crowdfund Insider

During the keynote address at Stanford's Rock Center for Corporate Governance at the event entitled "The Silicon Valley Initiative: Protecting Investments in Pre-IPO Issuers", SEC Chair Mary Jo White delivered a wide ranging speech on the challenges of operating in the internet fueled age of finance.
